meanings.definition: To act against or provide resistance to something.
meanings.sent1: She was opposing the new rule at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The two teams were opposing each other in the final match.
meanings.sent3: The cat was playfully opposing the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The waves opposing the shore reminded him of a never-ending battle.
meanings.sent5: His loud voice opposing the silence made everyone turn their heads.

meanings.definition: In a position facing or across from something.
meanings.sent1: The two friends sat opposing each other at the table.
meanings.sent2: The house was built opposing the park, offering a beautiful view.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat opposing the mirror, looking confused.
meanings.sent4: The mountains stood opposing the setting sun, casting long shadows.
meanings.sent5: The two cars parked opposing each other on the street.

meanings.sent1: The opposing viewpoints led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was of an opposing color to the rest of the room.
meanings.sent3: The opposing flavors of sweet and salty created a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The opposing forces of good and evil clashed in the story.
meanings.sent5: The opposing political parties had very different ideas about the issue.
